content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "http://thor-f5.er.usgs.gov/ngtoc/metadata/fgdc-std-001-1998.dtd"> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>         <pubdate>200603</pubdate>         <title>USGS Small-scale Dataset - Grayscale Alaska Shaded Relief - 200-Meter Resolution, Albers projection 200603 GeoTIFF</title>         <geoform>Map</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>           <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://dds.cr.usgs.gov/pub/data/nationalatlas/srgyaki200a_nt00312.tar.gz</onlink>         <lworkcit>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>             <pubdate>2013</pubdate>             <title>Small-scale Datasets</title>             <onlink>https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/532c5b23e4b0cd7393d07783</onlink>           </citeinfo>         </lworkcit>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract> The grayscale Alaska shaded relief data were derived from National  Elevation Dataset (NED) data, and show the terrain of Alaska at a  resolution of 200 meters.  The NED is a raster product assembled by the  U.S. Geological Survey, designed to provide national elevation data in a  seamless form with a consistent datum, elevation unit, and projection.  Data corrections made in the NED assembly process minimize artifacts,  permit edge matching, and fill sliver areas of missing data.  The National  Atlas also includes a Lambert Azimuthal Equal Area projection shaded  relief file; this file is the same data in an Albers projection.  </abstract>       <purpose> The grayscale shaded relief images were developed to portray the terrain  of the United States.  They are intended for visual purposes only.  The  original NED data must be used for conducting analysis and determining  elevation values.  </purpose>       <supplinf> The associated world file is included as part of the GeoTIFF.  The  contents of the world file are:  >200.0000  >0.000000  >0.000000  >-200.0000  >-3390900.0000  >2449900.0000    The following projection file can be used when using ESRI's ArcGIS to view  the GeoTIFF (any line breaks should be removed):  PROJCS["Albers_NAD_1983_Alaska",GEOGCS["GCS_North_American_1983",  DATUM["D_North_American_1983",SPHEROID["GRS_1980",6378137.0,  298.257222101]],PRIMEM["Greenwich",0.0],UNIT["Degree",  0.0174532925199433]],PROJECTION["Albers"],PARAMETER  ["False_Easting",0.0],PARAMETER["False_Northing",0.0],PARAMETER  ["Central_Meridian",-154.0],PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_1",55.0],  PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_2",65.0],PARAMETER  ["Latitude_Of_Origin",50.0],UNIT["Meter",1.0]]  ; {"gdaId" : 6065751}</supplinf>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>200603</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>Publication date</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>None planned</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>167</westbc>         <eastbc>-122</eastbc>         <northbc>77</northbc>         <southbc>40</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt>         <themekey>elevation</themekey>         <themekey>imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>National Atlas of the United States</themekey>         <themekey>Digital Elevation Model</themekey>         <themekey>Shaded Relief</themekey>         <themekey>Topography</themekey>         <themekey>Topographic</themekey>         <themekey>DEM</themekey>         <themekey>NED</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>The National Map Collection Thesaurus</themekt>         <themekey>Small-scale Datasets</themekey>         <themekey>Small-scale Datasets -         <edition>1</edition>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Sioux Falls, SD</pubplace>               <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>             </pubinfo> Dataset</srccitea>         <srccontr>Elevation information.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>National Atlas of the United States</origin>             <pubdate>1999</pubdate>             <title>Shoreline file in Lambert Azimuthal Equal Area projection</title>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>               <publish>National Atlas of the United States</publish>             </pubinfo>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>Internal file</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <rngdates>               <begdate>1972</begdate>               <enddate>1999</enddate>             </rngdates>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>Ground condition</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>shorelp020l</srccitea>         <srccontr>Shoreline mask for area of coverage.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc> Four elevation mosaics were extracted from the National Elevation  Dataset (NED) and used to produce the shaded relief images of the  conterminous United States, Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico and the U.S.  Virgin Islands.  A separate image was created for each of the four  areas because, at 200-meter resolution, file size for an elevation  mosaic of all of the United States would exceed the processing capacity  of some commonly-used GIS and image processing software packages.    For Alaska, elevation data were extracted from the NED and projected to  an Albers Conical Equal-Area projection, with a pixel size of 200  meters.  The datum for NED Alaska data is NAD27, so the data were  converted to NAD83 before the projection was performed.    Using the ArcInfo Polygrid command, a 0/1 land/water mask was created  for Alaska at the same 200 meter resolution as the elevation data, using  coastline data clipped from the National Atlas shoreline file.  The  land/water mask was applied to the 16-bit elevation grid.  The masked  elevation grid as well as the mask itself is available on request.  More  information on the NED may be found by following the links at  http://ned.usgs.gov.    Shaded relief was created from the masked land/water elevation data set  using the Arc/INFO Hillshade command with these  parameters:  >Azimuth 315 degrees  >Sun angle 45 degrees  >Vertical exaggeration factor 10    A second mask that separated U.S. land from non-U.S. land was created  with ArcInfo Polygrid, then applied to the shaded relief image in  Adobe Photoshop.  Oceans were set to (0,0,0) and non-U.S. land was set  to (182,182,182).  The masked image from Photoshop was saved as a TIFF,  ingested into ArcInfo 's Grid module, saved as a TIFF from ArcInfo, and  then processed through a USGS GeoTIFF software program to create a  fully-compliant GeoTIFF with valid header information.  </procdesc>         <srcused>National Elevation Dataset</srcused>         <srcused>shorelp020l</srcused>         <procdate>2004</procdate>       </procstep>     </lineage>   </dataqual>   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Raster</direct>     <rastinfo>       <rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype>       <rowcount>10580</rowcount>       <colcount>25545</colcount> <fnorth>0.0</fnorth>           </albers>         </mapproj>         <planci>           <plance>row and column</plance>           <coordrep>             <absres>200.0</absres>             <ordres>200.0</ordres>           </coordrep>           <plandu>meters</plandu>         </planci>       </planar>       <geodetic>         <horizdn>None</horizdn>         <ellips>Geodetic Reference System 80</ellips>         <semiaxis>6378137</semiaxis>         <denflat>298.2572221</denflat>       </geodetic>     </horizsys>   </spref>   <eainfo>     <detailed>       <enttyp>
